summary: The USTR Inspector General Act of 2025 proposes to establish an Inspector General within the Office of the United States Trade Representative (USTR). The bill amends Title 5 of the United States Code to include the USTR within existing Inspector General oversight. The President is mandated to appoint an Inspector General for the USTR within 120 days of the Act's enactment. The bill highlights Congress's role in international trade and the USTR's responsibilities.
